TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit IssuedSecurityTokenProvider extends System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider implements class System.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject
Public Class IssuedSecurityTokenProvider Inherits SecurityTokenProvider Implements ICommunicationObject
type IssuedSecurityTokenProvider = class inherit SecurityTokenProvider interface ICommunicationObject

Docs.summary: Represents a token provider for issued security tokens.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Care must be taken when caching and reusing security tokens that are returned from the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.IssuedSecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method, because the security token might become unusable when the channel that the token provider is associated with is closed. The security token becomes unusable when the requested key type is asymmetric and the thread is running under impersonated context when the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.IssuedSecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method is called.

Docs.param: A after which the call times out.
Docs.summary: Gets the token core.
Docs.returns: The that represents the token core.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Care must be taken when caching and reusing security tokens that are returned from the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.IssuedSecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method, because the security token might become unusable when the channel that the token provider is associated with is closed. The security token becomes unusable when the requested key type is asymmetric and the thread is running under impersonated context when the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.IssuedSecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method is called.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::ServiceModel::Security::IdentityVerifier ^ IdentityVerifier { System::ServiceModel::Security::IdentityVerifier ^ get(); void set(System::ServiceModel::Security::IdentityVerifier ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the identity verifier.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int IssuedTokenRenewalThresholdPercentage { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the issued token renewal threshold percentage.
Docs.value: The issued token renewal threshold percentage.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This percentage controls how often the token provider contacts the SecurityTokenService for a new issued token. For example, if the percentage is 90 percent, then the token provider will contact the SecurityTokenService when 90 percent of the issued token's validity interval is over.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IssuerChannelBehaviors As KeyedByTypeCollection(Of IEndpointBehavior)

Docs.summary: Gets the issuer channel behaviors.
Docs.value: A that contains the behaviors for the issuer channel.

remarks.format: ## Remarks These channel behaviors are added to the channel used by the token provider for the SecurityTokenService. The key for this collection is the URL of the security token service.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::ServiceModel::Security::SecurityKeyEntropyMode KeyEntropyMode { System::ServiceModel::Security::SecurityKeyEntropyMode get(); void set(System::ServiceModel::Security::SecurityKeyEntropyMode value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the key entropy mode.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is the key entropy mode used by the token provider when negotiating a symmetric key with the SecurityTokenService to use with the issued token.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TokenRequestParameters As Collection(Of XmlElement)

Docs.summary: Gets the token request parameters.
Docs.value: A collection of XML elements that represent the token request parameters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is a collection of XML elements that the token provider includes as part of the RequestSecurityToken it sends to the SecurityTokenService. These parameters can be set explicitly by the client or can be obtained from the relying party's security policy.
